page.title: 03CHANGES IN KILLAMARSH TOWN.
page.content: Killamarsh is a small village in north Derbyshire.It has grown in size over the last 50 years.The population has risen from 5,000 in 1935 to 11,000 in 1985. This was partly caused by the new housing estates.Over the past 50 years there have been many changes in work.In 1935 almost all men used to be miners but now they have many different jobs, in and out of the village. Many women have jobs now too instead of being mainly housewives. Transport has changed as well.In 1935 only rich people had cars but nowadays almost everyone has a car or even two.1935 shopping facilities were poor but now there are two supermarkets and many small shops.Rother Valley Park was built nearby,providing various water sports.There are also better recreation grounds with new playing fields,parks and the leisure centre.
